title: A handful of space companies are running out of cash and time. Here are three at risk
summary: The space sector’s on the tail end of a boom-and-bust cycle. While many companies battened down the hatches to survive, a few publicly-traded names are running on fumes.

title: Space Force selects vendors for suborbital launch services
summary: Kratos Space & Missile Defense Systems, L3Harris’ Aerojet Rocketdyne Coleman Aerospace, and Corvid Technologies were awarded indefinite-delivery indefinite-quantity (IDIQ) contracts for Sounding Rocket Program-4.

title: Spanish Government Awards €40.5M Loan to PLD Space for Miura 5
summary:
PLD Space has won the second and final round of a Spanish government call to develop sovereign launch capabilities. On 30 January 2023, the Spanish Ministry of Science and Innovation, through the country’s Center for Technological Development and Innovation (CDTI), published a call for the development of a small satellite launcher for which it had […]
The post Spanish Government Awards €40.5M Loan to PLD Space for Miura 5 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: JAXA’s SLIM Literally Lost An Engine, and NASA’s LRO Spots SLIM on the Surface
summary: A NASA spacecraft orbiting the Moon has spotted JAXA’s Smart Lander for Investigating Moon, or SLIM, that landed on the surface last week. The lander already was imaged much more […]

title: Virgin Galactic launches four private astronauts as it prepares to end Unity flights
summary: Virgin Galactic conducted its first suborbital mission of 2024 on Jan. 26 as the company prepares end flights of its current spaceplane.
